FuncDef:
The user-aging command sets the aging period of a local user account.
The undo user-aging command restores the default setting.
By default, a local user account does not age.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the aging period.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 365, in days.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To authorize the local administrator within a specified aging period, you can run the user-aging command. After the local administrator is created, the local administrator can log in to the
device and have specified rights till the aging period expires.
Configuration Impact
After the configured aging period elapses, users using the local user account fail to log in.
Precautions
The user-password change command that is configured in the AAA view or local AAA server view takes effect only for users in the specific view and does not affect another in the other view.
